industry: Investment Banking, Investment Management, and Financial Services
description:
A leading global investment management firm based in Los Angeles is looking for a professional, detail-oriented and process-driven Human Resources Operations Associate to join their team.


The ideal candidate will have a minimum of 3-5+ years of human resources, operations, and administrative experience within the financial and/or professional services industry. This is an incredible opportunity to take your human resources career to the next level and join a leading and well-renowned firm in the industry. Are you looking for your next challenge and long-term opportunity? Apply now!



Responsibilities included but not limited to:


  • Oversee administration of onboarding process; initiate hire and onboarding for new employees in Workday, complete E-Verify process, monitor new hire onboarding dashboard, and manage new employee inquires
  • Act as primary point of contact for all core HR data entry and transaction processing
  • Process and prepare paperwork in relation to promotions, transfers, and terminations
  • Draft offer letters and correspondence with candidate
  • Tracking employee files and maintaining all documentation
  • Manage background check process and consult with legal on anything that may arise
  • Assist with various administrative actions related to human resources initiatives
  • Special projects and other duties as needed


Qualifications:


  • Minimum 3-5+ years’ of experience working in human resources/operations or an administrative and process driven role within the human resources department
  • Experience working in the financial services and/or professional services industry is required
  • High attention to detail and excellent verbal and written communication skills
  • Ability to juggle multiple projects, work independently, and collaboratively with a team
  • Ability to maintain highly confidential and sensitive information in compliance with HR and firm-wide policies
  • Bachelor's Degree is strongly preferred
  • Ability to work onsite 3x a week in Los Angeles is required


Please submit your resume for consideration.


You can use WorkGrades to collect and manage your references for free and share them with us or anyone else you choose by visiting workgrades.com/home/candidate. Candidates with references are always preferred by our clients. Now is the most important time to stand out from the crowd. We suggest that you ensure you have updated your LinkedIn profile and that you start collecting your references early.


We will consider qualified candidates with criminal histories in a manner consistent with the requirements of the Los Angeles Fair Chance Initiative for Hiring.
